articles.description: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to bypass authentication on affected installations of Vinchin Backup and Recovery. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability.

articles.author: Ax Sharma
articles.description: On Friday, the Python Package Index (PyPI), repository of open source Python projects announced plans to rollout two factor authentication for maintainers of "critical" projects. Although many praised the move, the developer of a popular Python project decided to delete his code from PyPI in retaliation. [...]
articles.title: PyPI mandates 2FA for critical projects, developer pushes back

articles.description:
A newly observed phishing campaign is leveraging the recently disclosed Follina security vulnerability to distribute a previously undocumented backdoor on Windows systems. “Rozena is a backdoor malware that is capable of injecting a remote shell connection back to the attacker’s machine,” Fortinet FortiGuard Labs researcher Cara Lin said in a report this week. Tracked as CVE-2022-30190, the Source::… Read More »Hackers Exploiting Follina Bug to Deploy Rozena Backdoor

Amazon SageMaker model training now supports heterogeneous clusters, which enables launching training jobs that use multiple instance types in a single job. This new capability can improve your training cost by running different parts of the model training on the most suitable instance type. For example, we recently trained a ResNet-50 computer vision model on a… Read More »Announcing Heterogeneous Clusters for Amazon SageMaker model training

Cybersecurity researchers are drawing attention to an ongoing wave of attacks linked to a threat cluster tracked as Raspberry Robin that’s behind a Windows malware with worm-like capabilities.  Describing it as a “persistent” and “spreading” threat, Cybereason said it observed a number of victims in Europe. The infections involve a worm that propagates over removable USB devices… Read More »Researchers Warn of Raspberry Robin’s Worm Targeting Windows Users
